org.midica.ui.info

Class InfoView

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Dialog
            • javax.swing.JDialog
              • org.midica.ui.info.InfoView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class InfoView
extends javax.swing.JDialog

    This class defines the GUI view for the information about the current state of the program instance. It contains the following types of information:

    • Configuration (currently configured values for different configurable elements)
      • Note names
      • Percussion instrument shortcuts
      • Syntax keywords for MidicaPL
      • Instrument shortcuts for non-percussion instruments
    • Information about the currently loaded soundfont
      • General information
      • Drum kits and Instruments
      • Resources
    • Information about the currently loaded MIDI sequence.
      • General information
      • Banks, Instruments and Notes
      • MIDI Messages
    • General Midica version and build information.
    Author:
    Jan Trukenm√ºller
    See Also:

      • init

        private void init()

        Initializes the content of all the tabs inside the info view.

      • createConfigArea

        private java.awt.Container createConfigArea()

        Creates the configuration tab. This contains the following sub tabs:

        • Note details
        • Percussion details
        • Syntax details
        • Instrument details
        Returns:
        the created configuration area.

      • createSoundfontArea

        private java.awt.Container createSoundfontArea()

        Creates the soundfont tab. This contains the following sub tabs:

        • General soundfont info
        • Instruments and drum kits
        • Resources
        Returns:
        the created soundfont area.

      • createMidiSequenceArea

        private java.awt.Container createMidiSequenceArea()

        Creates the MIDI sequence tab. This contains the following sub tabs:

        • General sequence info
        • Used banks, instruments and played notes
        • MIDI Messages (containing tree, details and table)
        Returns:
        the created soundfont area.

      • createNoteArea

        private java.awt.Container createNoteArea()

        Creates the note area containing the translation table for note names. The table translates between MIDI note values and their configured names.

        Returns:
        the created note area.

      • createPercussionArea

        private java.awt.Container createPercussionArea()

        Creates the percussion area containing the translation table for percussion shortcuts. The table translates between MIDI note values for the percussion channel and their configured shortcuts.

        Returns:
        the created percussion area

      • createSyntaxArea

        Creates the syntax area containing the translation table for syntax keywords.

        Returns:
        the created syntax area

      • createInstrumentArea

        Returns:
        the created instrument area

      • createBankInstrNoteAreaHalf

        private java.awt.Container createBankInstrNoteAreaHalf(boolean isTotal)

        Creates the area for banks, instruments and notes used by the loaded MIDI sequence, either in total or per channel.

        Parameters:
        isTotal - true for creating the total usage tree area. false for the per channel area.
        Returns:
        the created area.

      • createMsgFilterArea

        private java.awt.Container createMsgFilterArea(long minTick,
                                               long maxTick)

        Creates the message filter area.

        The given parameters are used to prefill the tick fields.

        Parameters:
        minTick - Lowest tick from the sequence or 0 if no sequence is loaded.
        maxTick - Highest tick from the sequence or 0 if no sequence is loaded.
        Returns:
        the created area.

      • createMsgFilterChannelCheckboxes

        private java.awt.Container createMsgFilterChannelCheckboxes()

        Creates the channel checkboxes for the message filter area.

        Returns:
        the created area.

      • createMsgFilterLine3

        private java.awt.Container createMsgFilterLine3()

        Creates third line of the message filter area.

        This line contains the show-in-tree button, the auto-show checkbox and the counts of visible and total messages.

        Returns:
        the created area.

      • showInfoWindow

        public static void showInfoWindow(java.awt.Window owner)

        Creates and shows the info view passing the specified owner window to the constructor.

        If an info view already exists it will be destroyed before. This is done in order to make sure that the newly created info view:

        • exists only once
        • will be in the foreground
        • will be focused
        Parameters:
        owner - The GUI window owning the info window.

      • cleanMsgDetails

        public void cleanMsgDetails()

        Removes all contents from the message details area.

      • fillMsgDetails

        public void fillMsgDetails(IMessageType messageSource)

        Fills the details area with the given content. Before calling this method, cleanMsgDetails() should be called first.

        Adjusts the background color according to the click source (message table or message tree)

        Parameters:
        messageSource - The selected leaf node or table row object.

      • close

        public void close()

        Closes and destroys the info window.

      • addKeyBindings

        public void addKeyBindings()

        Adds key bindings to the info window.
